channel.title: Will jagex ever sell out and release a lan version/offline version of 07sc
channel.description: just as the title says please express your opinion on this subject. i wanna know what mopar thinks of this subject

item.title: Will jagex ever sell out and release a lan version/offline version of 07sc
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

ixia:

Okay go and work on your very own game, make all the models yourself, spend years doing it then release the code k?

All of my software projects are fully open source… the only time I’d close source something would be if it contained functionality that would destroy my entire business model. Anyway, you’re missing the point. Firstly, I wasn’t saying they should open source it - I was saying that public knowledge of their backend code wouldn’t lose them all of their players. If I made a perfect and complete RS clone I still wouldn’t be able to take any significant amount of their playerbase. If I did become a threat to them I’d just get shutdown… so it’s not that big of a deal.

If they made an offline version it would certainly be much more difficult to get the sourcecode than it is from the deobs… For that to happen they wouldn’t do it on Java.[/quote]
Thanks for the facepalm buddy, I’m glad you think I’m an idiot. I don’t think the decompilability of their code really matters. There’s always going to be some way of extracting any secret code/information, whether people decompile the Java classes, read memory or even instrument the assembly. If they don’t want people simply decompiling and hitting run then a deob is fine, but there’s just no point in trying to obfusticate code further by choosing different languages. If they truly have any serious information to hide then they shouldn’t release anything. But my original post was raising the question about what sort of information this could be… to which I’ve had no responses from either of you. (lol models, they’re client-side mate)

Read full topic
item.source: Will jagex ever sell out and release a lan version/offline version of 07sc

item.title: Will jagex ever sell out and release a lan version/offline version of 07sc
item.dc:creator: @ixia ixia
item.description:
@ixia wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:8, topic:536237”][quote author=ixia link=topic=655050.msg4386596#msg4386596 date=1385818678]

[quote author=Wintercanon link=topic=655050.msg4386590#msg4386590 date=1385815494]

I think he meant a offline single player version of the game.

If that is the case, it’s really easy to rework the client so that it can work as a single player client (without needing to make a connection to an external server).

The actual source code for RuneScape will most likely never be released.
[/quote]Most of the game logic is in the server. They would have to realise the ‘actual source code’ to provide an offline version.

They wouldn’t need to write it in Java so if they wrote it as an application in C++ or something, decompiling would be near impossible to do.
[/quote]…would there really be anything that innovative about their backend code? it’s not like their business model is based on top secret algorithms.[/quote]
Okay go and work on your very own game, make all the models yourself, spend years doing it then release the code k?

Read full topic
item.source: Will jagex ever sell out and release a lan version/offline version of 07sc

item.title: Will jagex ever sell out and release a lan version/offline version of 07sc
item.dc:creator: @Decoder Decoder
item.description:
@Decoder wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:8, topic:536237”][quote author=ixia link=topic=655050.msg4386596#msg4386596 date=1385818678]

[quote author=Wintercanon link=topic=655050.msg4386590#msg4386590 date=1385815494]

I think he meant a offline single player version of the game.

If that is the case, it’s really easy to rework the client so that it can work as a single player client (without needing to make a connection to an external server).

The actual source code for RuneScape will most likely never be released.
[/quote]Most of the game logic is in the server. They would have to realise the ‘actual source code’ to provide an offline version.

They wouldn’t need to write it in Java so if they wrote it as an application in C++ or something, decompiling would be near impossible to do.
[/quote]…would there really be anything that innovative about their backend code? it’s not like their business model is based on top secret algorithms.[/quote]
:palm:
If they made an offline version it would certainly be much more difficult to get the sourcecode than it is from the deobs… For that to happen they wouldn’t do it on Java.

Read full topic

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:6, topic:536237”][quote author=ixia link=topic=655050.msg4386588#msg4386588 date=1385813885]
I think he meant a offline single player version of the game.

If that is the case, it’s really easy to rework the client so that it can work as a single player client (without needing to make a connection to an external server).

The actual source code for RuneScape will most likely never be released.
[/quote]Most of the game logic is in the server. They would have to realise the ‘actual source code’ to provide an offline version.[/quote]
They wouldn’t need to write it in Java so if they wrote it as an application in C++ or something, decompiling would be near impossible to do.
